summary: This is an FBI intake document from July 2020, recording a social media tip forwarded by the FBI Office of Public Affairs. The tip references a tweet by Ellen Pao suggesting Ghislaine Maxwell was involved in providing underage females to celebrities for sex. The document details the automated process for flagging social media content containing keywords like 'gun'.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the case title for child sex trafficking; the subject of the broader investigation to which this social media tip is related.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the forwarded social media comment as being allegedly involved in providing underage females for sex to celebrities.

persons.name: Ellen Pao
persons.context: Identified as an American investor and activist whose tweet (@ekp) is referenced as containing allegations about Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: The document context implies Maxwell's alleged involvement in Epstein's child sex trafficking activities, as referenced in the social media tip.

events.title: Social media tip forwarded to FBI
events.description: The FBI Office of Public Affairs forwarded a social media comment referencing a tweet by Ellen Pao that contained allegations about Ghislaine Maxwell's involvement in providing underage females for sex.

keyFacts: The FBI received a tip on July 6, 2020, based on a social media comment referencing allegations that Ghislaine Maxwell was involved in providing underage females for sex to celebrities.
The tip was generated through an automated system that monitors the FBI's social media accounts for keywords, with 'gun' being the keyword identified in this instance.
The document shows the FBI's process for intake and assessment of publicly submitted information, even from social media, related to the Jeffrey Epstein child sex trafficking investigation.
